section.title: Bare metal deployment
section.para: For bare metal deployment, we need to provide information about the node to the Cobbler system on the Spacewalk server, d21sw1.

In , we showed the Cobbler script for the ds1 system. We use it as a basis to create the Cobbler scripts for placing the ant1 node to Cobbler.
&sw1p; sed \ -e 's/ds1/ant1/g' \ -e 's/192\.168\.5\.14/192.168.5.20/g' \ -e 's/DS 1 test node/ANT 1 test node/g' \ -e 's/52:54:00:a8:05:0e/52:54:00:a8:05:14/g' \ cobbler-ds1.sh > cobbler-ant1.sh

Add the systems to Cobbler:
&sw1p; chmod u+x cobbler-ant1.sh &sw1p; cobbler system remove --name SpacewalkDefaultOrganization_kvm_ant1; ./cobbler-ant1.sh

The boot ISO is created with:
&sw1p; sudo cobbler buildiso --iso=/var/www/cobbler/pub/example/centos6u5-ant1-kvm.iso --profiles="" --systems="SpacewalkDefaultOrganization_kvm_ant1" --tempdir=/tmp &sw1p; ls -lh /var/www/cobbler/pub/example/centos6u5-ant1-kvm.iso -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 37M Jul 7 22:43 /var/www/cobbler/pub/example/centos6u5-ant1-kvm.iso

The boot ISO needs to be copied to the KVM host:
&sw1p; scp /var/www/cobbler/pub/example/centos6u5-ant1-kvm.iso root@192.168.5.1:/var/lib/libvirt/isos root@192.168.5.1's password: redhat centos6u5-ant1-kvm.iso 100% 36MB 36.3MB/s 00:00

Installation on the machines is done with:
&hostp; cat install-ant1.sh #!/bin/bash
virt-install \ --connect qemu:///system \ --name=ant1 \ --ram=512 \ --arch=x86_64 \ --description="ANT 1 test node" \ --cdrom /var/lib/libvirt/isos/centos6u5-ant1-kvm.iso \ --os-type=linux \ --os-variant=rhel6 \ --disk path=/dev/vg_vm/ant1,device=disk,bus=virtio \ --network=network=svcs,mac=52:54:00:a8:05:14 \ --graphics vnc \ --hvm \ --autostart

Make sure the script is executable and then start it as root on the host:
&hostp; chmod u+x install-ant1.sh &hostp; ./install-ant1.sh
